intro: Lepidium oligodontum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, elongated leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are tiny, yellowish-white, and arranged in clusters, typical of the Brassicaceae family. Lepidium oligodontum is often found in arid environments and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient soils.
